text: <@U2Q9WMZ0D|mdelmott> has joined the channel
Hi everybody, I would like to know how to deploy a chaincode in Bluemix and call it with the bluemix blockchain service.
Or with another web application.
<@U2Q9WMZ0D> you can use this tutorial: <https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles>
thanks <@U2RMVHMK9>
<@U2ALHGKK4|snehalpansare> has joined the channel

Hi
I am trying to run Hyperledger docker image on Mac as well as Windows
On both , I am getting an error when I try to deploy a chaincode through CLI
On Mac : I getting error below "dial unix /var/run/docker/sock no such file or directory"  
On Windows : I am getting an error as : "malformed HTTP response "\x15\x03\x01\x00\x02\x02\x16""
<@U2ALHGKK4> Not sure about the malformed response, but shouldn't it be "/var/run/docker.sock" not "/var/run/docker/sock"
<https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/archives/dockerimages/p1478518175000360>

attachments.fallback: [November 7th, 2016 3:29 AM] ghaskins: <@U2ALHGKK4> the peer needs to have access to create/run docker containers itself, as this is what the chaincode instances will execute under....as such, you need to either a) share the /var/run/docker.sock with the peer container with a volume mount (e.g. -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock), or to b) point the peer to a network accessible instance via the CORE_VM_ENDPOINT environment variable
attachments.text: <@U2ALHGKK4> the peer needs to have access to create/run docker containers itself, as this is what the chaincode instances will execute under....as such, you need to either a) share the /var/run/docker.sock with the peer container with a volume mount (e.g. -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock), or to b) point the peer to a network accessible instance via the CORE_VM_ENDPOINT environment variable

text: <@U2W7U5UA3> I took that to be a typo/faulty-memory and not the literal error message
<@U2ALHGKK4> BTW, the format of the variable looks like "CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:2375>"
heres a working example: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/bddtests/compose-defaults.yml>

<@U2W7U5UA3> <@U0KPFAZNF> I bypassed docker.sock error , now I am getting a new error - Error building images: Tag latest not found in repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
<@U2ALHGKK4> the short answer is: binary deployment is not yet supported (<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-678>)
the long answer is, you can work around it (for now) if you really want to
it will eventually be more turnkey
long story short, the only deployment model that is truly supported right now is building the fabric from source, as baseimage:latest is synthesized by the build
but if you are willing to rejigger a few things, you can get your environment aligned so it will run
i assume you are running v0.6.1-preview?
<@U2ALHGKK4> ^^^^
<@U2RMVHMK9> I tried the auto deploy and fro what i gathered from the error message was that it was unable to find the blockchain

bunch of new videos posted on <#C28M6TC90|playbacks> and our youtube channel at <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCFdgCWH_1vCndMPVqQlwZw> Check them out and subscribe… including how to name your chaincode, I know everyone has been looking forward to that.
